parts.text: {"word":"lade","priority":"★☆☆","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(船・乗り物など)に積み込む、積載する","english_definition":"to load (a ship, truck, etc.)","examples":[{"sentence":"They lade the ship with cargo.","translation":"彼らは船に貨物を積み込む。"},{"sentence":"The trucks were laden with supplies.","translation":"トラックには物資が積まれていた。"}],"collocations":["lade a ship","lade a truck","lade with cargo","lade with supplies"],"synonyms":["load","burden","charge"],"antonyms":["unload","discharge","empty"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vt","definition":"(荷など)を積んで重くする、満たす","english_definition":"to weigh down with a load; burden","examples":[{"sentence":"The trees were laden with fruit.","translation":"木々は果実で重く垂れ下がっていた。"},{"sentence":"Her heart was laden with sorrow.","translation":"彼女の心は悲しみで満たされていた。"}],"collocations":["laden with fruit","laden with sorrow","laden with guilt"],"synonyms":["burden","weigh down","fill"],"antonyms":["relieve","empty"]},{"part_of_speech":"noun","definition":"積荷、積み込み","english_definition":"a load; cargo","examples":[{"sentence":"The ship carried a lade of timber.","translation":"その船は木材の積荷を運んだ。"}],"collocations":["a lade of timber","a heavy lade"],"synonyms":["load","cargo","burden"],"antonyms":["unloading"]}],"etymology":{"value":"Old English *hladan* meaning 'to load, heap, pile'. Proto-Germanic *hlaþanan*.","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/leɪd/","syllables":"1"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["lade","lades"],"past_simple":"laded","past_participle":"laded" , "laden" , "lad","present_participle":"lading"},"noun_plural":"lades"},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"'Lade' is a somewhat archaic word, and 'load' is more commonly used in modern English. 'Laden' is frequently used as an adjective.","priority":"★★☆"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"The ship was load with cargo.","correct":"The ship was laden with cargo.","note":"Use 'laden' as an adjective."}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["laden","lading"],"phrasal_verbs":[]},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"N/A","frequency_google_ngram":"Very low","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"C2","text":"'Lade' is a less common word meaning 'to load'. It is more often encountered in older literature. The adjective 'laden' is more frequently used to describe something heavily loaded or burdened."},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The ship was being **laded** with grain.","translation":"その船には穀物が積み込まれていた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"積載する"},{"sentence":"The branches were **laden** with snow.","translation":"枝は雪で重く垂れ下がっていた。","type":"adjective (past participle)","meaning_category":"満たす"},{"sentence":"The **lade** of the ship consisted of spices and silk.","translation":"その船の積荷は香辛料と絹で構成されていた。","type":"noun","meaning_category":"積荷"}]}
